entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 12:19PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dauphin Island through 100 PM CDT... At 1215 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dauphin Island to 8 miles east of Petit Bois Island. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued March 28 at 9:56AM PDT until March 29 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Flood Watch in effect due to periods of heavy rain in the Sierra Nevada Foothills for locations below the snow line. Heavy rain associated with an Atmospheric River is possible tonight, which may lead to areas of flooding on already saturated soil. Another window for heavy rain may exist Wednesday afternoon with the potential for thunderstorm activity.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT WEDNESDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Heaviest snow in Yakima County. * WHERE...Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest
